personalInfo.splInterest: Fishing, sports, hanging out with his family and his dog

tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Finished the Web.com Tour season with 20 starts, one third-place finish, three top-10s, seven top-25s and 15 cuts made. Was 45th on the combined Regular Season/Finals' money list…Enjoyed a T15 in the season-opener in Panama, at the Panama Claro Championship…Traveled to the Chile Classic, where a third-round 65 moved him well up the leaderboard. A final-round 67 that included birdies on Nos. 17 and 18 led to a T8…In June, recorded his first top-five performance on Tour at the Air Capital Classic in Wichita. Posted 68-66 and was bogey-free through the first 36 holes. Climbed his way into contention with a third-round 65, putting him two strokes off the lead. On Sunday, made birdies on the first two holes. Could only muster pars from there on, with two bogeys sprinkled in. The even-par 70 placed him T3, moving him to 41st in earnings, his high mark of the year…Would make the cut in his last six Regular Season events, placing him 51st on the money list heading into the Finals…In the Web.com Tour Finals, made a nice run at getting his card. Opened with T69 (Hotel Fitness Championship) and T25 (Small Business Conection Championship at River Run) before withdrawing in the third event in Ohio, the Nationwide Children's Hospital Championship…At the Web.com Tour Championship, had three rounds in the 60s, leading to a T12 finish. Came up $2,860 shy of the 25th position and last PGA TOUR card available via the Finals, finishing 31st on the Finals' money list… Played in two PGA TOUR Latinoamérica events, claiming a victory on his first start at the Mundo Maya Open in Merida, Mexico in October. Entered the final round trailing by four shots, but carded a 65 to win by two over 54-leader Daniel Stapff. Finished T16 at the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica Tour Championship in December to finish the year ranked 33rd on the Order of Merit.

2014: Finished T79 at the Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament in December...Played in 12 Web.com Tour events, posting two top-10s and three top-25s. Made six cuts. Finished the season 84th on the money list...First top-25, a T15, came in July at the Utah Championship, where he shot four rounds in the 60s...Three weeks later, recorded his best finish of the year, a T8 at the Stonebrae Classic. Opened with 63-67-63 and was one stroke off the lead. Was within two of the lead after 15 holes in the final round. Bogeys on the final three holes resulted in a T8...At the Regular Season-ending WinCo Foods Portland Open, carded 66-64 the first two days. Was one stroke off the lead but carded a 76 on Saturday to fall from contention. Bounced back with a 69 in the final round for a T9...In June, qualified for the U.S. Open, making the cut and finishing T56 at Pinehurst in his first Open appearance...Played in three PGA TOUR Latinoamérica events. Finished T9 at the Mundo Maya Open in April. In October, captured the Colombian Classic, firing 67-68-67-67 to win by one. Added a T6 the next week at the Mazatlan Open and finished 20th on the Order of Merit. 

2013: Had seven mini-tour wins in Florida. 

2012: In his Web.com Tour debut, missed the cut at the Miccosukee Championship.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Took up the game at age of 19…Did not attend college.
tourBios.personal: Attended El Toro High School in Lake Forest, Calif. Played on the baseball team, where he was a pitcher. Injured his elbow and that led to his starting to play golf. Sister was a highly recruited player at Florida State University…If not a professional golfer, would be a coach or instructor…Biggest thrill in golf was qualifying for and playing in the 2014 U.S. Open at Pinehurst's No. 2 Course…Favorite app is Pandora…Favorite TV shows are "Wheel of Fortune" and "Jeopardy!" Favorite movie is "Step Brothers," and he enjoys eating at In-N-Out Burgers…Likes tropical and warm locales…Golf bag snack is beef jerky and nuts…Not many people know he grew up skateboarding and has only been playing golf since 2003, moving to Florida in 2007 to pursue a professional career…Hopes to travel to "exotic destinations."

tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Next 25 Money Winners from 2015 Web.com Tour Finals

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour in 2016 is T13th at the Club Colombia Championship Presented by Claro.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks 28th in Scoring Average (Actual) on the Web.com Tour.
